name: AFD 13 Timing Benchmarks (Transcript-First MVP)
description: Represents the AFD 13 timing benchmarks as an auditable scorecard. For MVP, benchmarks are scored only when the transcript contains explicit radio evidence; otherwise mark not_observed (do not guess). Later phases can add optional manual inputs from CAD/VisiNet.

sections.title: Clocking & Evidence Rules
sections.description: Clock starts when the first unit arrives (per AFD guidance). If the transcript does not include explicit statements for a benchmark, mark not_observed.

criteria.title: First unit arrival time identifiable in transcript
criteria.description: The radio traffic includes an explicit 'on scene/arrived' statement that can anchor timing benchmarks.
criteria.notes: If arrival is not identifiable, timing benchmarks should generally be not_observed to avoid fabricated timing.

sections.title: Incident Stabilization Benchmarks
sections.description: Benchmarks related to fire control/stabilization. Score only if explicitly stated.

criteria.title: Command established (< 3 minutes)
criteria.description: Command established within 3 minutes of arrival (if both events are observable).

criteria.title: First water on fire (< 2 minutes from arrival)
criteria.description: First water on fire within 2 minutes of arrival (if the transcript explicitly indicates 'water on the fire' or equivalent).

criteria.title: Fire knocked down (< 20 minutes)
criteria.description: Fire knocked down is announced within 20 minutes of arrival (if observable).

criteria.title: Fire under control (< 30 minutes)
criteria.description: Fire under control is announced within 30 minutes of arrival (if observable).

criteria.title: Fire extinguished (< 1 hour)
criteria.description: Fire extinguished is announced within 1 hour of arrival (if observable).

sections.title: Life Safety Benchmarks
sections.description: Benchmarks related to search completion and safety-critical reporting. Score only if explicitly stated.

criteria.title: Primary search complete (< 10 minutes)
criteria.description: Primary search completion is announced within 10 minutes of arrival (if observable).

criteria.title: Secondary search complete (< 20 minutes post-knockdown)
criteria.description: Secondary search completion is announced within 20 minutes after knockdown (if observable).
criteria.notes: This benchmark depends on knockdown being observable; otherwise mark not_observed.

sections.title: Support / Property Conservation Benchmarks
sections.description: Water supply, utilities, salvage. These are often not explicitly stated in radio traffic; use not_observed when missing.

criteria.title: Water supply established (< 5 minutes)
criteria.description: Water supply established within 5 minutes of arrival (if observable).

criteria.title: Utility shutoff (< 10 minutes)
criteria.description: Utility shutoff is announced within 10 minutes of arrival (if observable).

criteria.title: Salvage complete (as soon as possible after knockdown)
criteria.description: Salvage completion is announced (if observable). Timing target is informational; mark not_observed if not present.
